title: 106_hr4909
content: The "Veterans Compensation Equity Act of 2000" allows veterans who received the Purple Heart to receive both retired pay and disability retirement concurrently. The "Veterans Compensation Equity Act of 2000" allows Purple Heart recipients with 20 years of service to receive both retirement pay and disability compensation concurrently, without any deductions. Additionally, disability compensation cannot affect eligibility for other benefits under Federal, State, or local law. The "Veterans Compensation Equity Act of 2000" allows Purple Heart recipients with 20 years of service to receive retirement pay and disability compensation concurrently without deductions. Disability compensation cannot affect eligibility for other benefits under Federal, State, or local law. The amendments made by this Act will apply to payments starting from the enactment date. The "Veterans Compensation Equity Act of 2000" allows Purple Heart recipients with 20 years of service to receive retirement pay and disability compensation concurrently without deductions. The act also ensures that the rate of dependency and indemnity compensation paid to the surviving spouse of a Purple Heart recipient is equivalent to the compensation the veteran would receive if alive. This amendment applies to payments starting from the enactment date. SEC. 4. Annuities under Survivor Benefit Plan to be 100 percent of retired pay amount. The amendment to Section 1451 of title 10, United States Code, changes the calculation of benefits to be 100 percent of the base amount, with adjustments based on subsection (f). The amendment to Section 1451 of title 10, United States Code, changes the calculation of benefits to 100 percent of retired pay based on years of active service. Subsections (d) and (e) are repealed, and a conforming amendment is made to subsection (f). The amendments made by this section change the calculation of benefits for annuities under the Survivor Benefit Plan. The effective date applies to annuities starting after the enactment of the Act, and existing annuities will be recomputed to reflect the changes.
